Rulings.Edison:
●When this card’s effect is active, both Decks are flipped upside down, and now the face of the top card of the Deck is showing.
●If a card effect requires a player to shuffle their Deck, it is shuffled and cut face-down so the cards are not seen, and then placed face-up in the Deck Zone.
●If a Parasite Paracide is face-up in your Deck before this card is activated, it will become face-down once this card is active. Its effect will still activate when it is drawn.
●If 2 copies of Convulsion of Nature are active, the Decks are still upside-down (they don't revert to normal).
Rulings.Tengu:
●When this card’s effect is active, both Decks are flipped upside down, and now the face of the top card of the Deck is showing.
●If a card effect requires a player to shuffle their Deck, it is shuffled and cut face-down so the cards are not seen, and then placed face-up in the Deck Zone.
●If a Parasite Paracide is face-up in your Deck before this card is activated, it will become face-down once this card is active. Its effect will still activate when it is drawn.
●If 2 copies of Convulsion of Nature are active, the Decks are still upside-down (they do not revert to normal).
Rulings.Goat:
●When this card’s effect is applying, both Decks are flipped upside down, and now the face of the top card of the Deck is showing.
●If a card effect requires a player to shuffle their Deck, it is shuffled and cut face-down so the cards are not seen, and then placed face-up in the Deck Zone.
●If a Parasite Paracide is face-up in your Deck before this card is activated, it will become face-down once this card is applying. Its effect will still activate when it is drawn.
●If 2 copies of Convulsion of Nature are applying, the Decks are still upside-down (they do not revert to normal).
●Cards that are turned face-up in the deck will be drawn face-down while “Convulsion of Nature” is applying, but still will resolve properly.

Rulings.Base:
1. When this card's effect is active, both Decks are flipped upside down, and now the face of the top card of the Deck is showing.
2. If a card effect requires a player to shuffle their Deck, it is shuffled and cut face-down so the cards are not seen, and then placed face-up in the Deck Zone.
3. If a "Parasite Paracide" is face-up in your Deck before this card is activated, it will become face-down once this card is active. Its effect will still activate when it is drawn.
4. If 2 copies of "Convulsion of Nature" are active, the Decks are still upside-down (they do not revert to normal).

PSCT.Base: As long as this card remains face-up on the field, both players must turn their respective Decks upside down and proceed with the current Duel.
